p: Inert dusts such as diatomaceous earths (DEs), composed of amorphous SiO 2, derived from fossilized diatoms, are already registered and commercialized as grain protectant. However, to be effective they need to be applied at high dosages (0.5–3.5 g∙kg −1 grain), causing increase of the grain bulk weight, decrease in quality, and interferences with machinery functioning [ 15].
